item.title: Barnaby Joyce denies allegation he yelled at staffer
item.description: The prominent Nationals MP, who is taking time away from his party, says he will respect the formal process into the allegation but denies it.

item.title: Chris Marco jailed over Ponzi-style fraud involving hundreds of Perth investors
item.description: A Perth businessman who defrauded clients of more than $34 million in what was described as a "Ponzi scheme" has been sentenced to 14 years in prison.

item.description: Police are investigating after an eight-month-old baby was found dead at a home in Perth's southern suburbs.

item.description: The Socceroos have historically been seen as plucky underdogs at the FIFA World Cup. Now, Tony Popovic believes those same traits can see his side create history.

item.title: How size inclusivity at fashion shows can have a big impact on broader society
item.description: Curve model Annika Nielsen says representation is sometimes "something that you don't realise that you miss or that you need until you see it".

item.title: Snowy Monaro councillor Andrew Thaler disqualified after third misconduct suspension
item.description: Snowy Monaro councillor Andrew Thaler has been notified he will be disqualified from council for five years after receiving a third suspension for misconduct. He is only the second NSW councillor to be dealt with under the three-strike system.

item.title: Donald Trump's campaign against Venezuelan drug boats is rooted in past failure and a hatred of Nicolas Maduro
item.description: Donald Trump is on a revenge tour during his second stint in the White House and now his gaze has shifted to an enemy who once "humiliated" him — Nicolas Maduro.

item.title: Rallen Australia loses trademark battle with gas company over 'Tanumbirini'
item.description: One of the Northern Territory's largest beef producers has failed in its bid to stop a gas company from trademarking the name of one of its cattle stations.

item.description: James Hardie has a long history of attempting to avoid its responsibilities. The drama began when the company announced a $14 billion purchase of a rival firm.

item.title: WA Police investigate criminal damage at Masjid Al-Rahmān mosque in Gosnells
item.description: Specialist detectives who handle racially motivated threats are investigating an incident at a mosque in Perth's south-east in which a mystery offender poured non-flammable motor oil across the main entrance.

item.description: Pictures of the aftermath of Hurricane Melissa, the "storm of the century" that tore through Jamaica, Cuba and Haiti, reveal a trail of damage and displacement.

item.description: The settling of tariffs, a lengthy discussion on the war in Ukraine, and effusive praise for the Chinese leader — here are the main takeaways from the meeting between Donald Trump and Xi Jinping.

item.description: Australia's Women's Cricket World Cup dream is over, ended by India and the greatest run chase in tournament history in a gripping semifinal. Follow live.

item.description: The number of patients requiring follow-up rises to 21, after a medical imaging bungle at Caboolture Hospital's outpatient service in which test results went unchecked.

item.description: A Perth man who raped two teenagers more than 30 years ago but was only charged last year after a genetic genealogy breakthrough, is jailed for 13 and a half years.

item.title: Dutch centrist Rob Jetten 'confident' as Geert Wilders' far-right party suffers setback in election
item.description: Geert Wilders' Freedom Party lost ground in elections which had been seen as a potential test of the far-right's staying power in European politics.

item.title: Dictionary.com's surprising choice for word of the year — 'six-seven'
item.description: Unveiling its choice for word of the year, Dictionary.com explained that it was not quite sure what six-seven meant.

item.description: A ratepayers' group is calling for an audit of the $20 million redevelopment of Launceston's heritage-listed Albert Hall for what it says are design flaws.

item.description: There are grave concerns that dangerous language and bullying of farmers who are hosting renewable energy projects on their properties could turn into violence.

item.description: Food manufacturers are responding to high cocoa prices, and a change to the UK's Penguin biscuit may have all but cemented Australia's Tim Tam as the better of the two.

item.description: Just three months into 2021, Frank Coleman was the ninth Indigenous death in custody in New South Wales.

item.title: Nationals ditch net zero support in party platform
item.description: The decision by the party's Federal Council does not bind federal parliamentarians but could pave the way for them to make a similar move as early as this week.

item.title: Rural students got game at Riverina leg of national FUSE Cup esport competition
item.description: Too much gaming time can be considered problematic. But, for these kids, it represents camaraderie, competition and the possibility of a future career.

item.title: Liam Gallagher incensed by flare let off at Melbourne Oasis concert
item.description: A flare let off by a crowd member at the first of three Melbourne Oasis concerts has angered the band's co-founder Liam Gallagher, sparking an expletive-laden post.

item.title: WHO confirms militia attack on hospital that killed 460 people in Sudan's Darfur region
item.description: The World Health Organization says the attack this week involved gunmen striking in several waves, abducting doctors and nurses, gunning down staff, patients and people sheltering there.

item.title: South African government criticises Trump's refugee policy prioritising white Afrikaner minority
item.description: On Thursday, the Trump administration announced its refugee policy would prioritise admitting Afrikaners, South Africa's white minority group.

item.title: Warren Tredrea was the Power's premiership captain, but has now been booted from its board
item.description: The Port Adelaide Football Club continues to describe Warren Tredrea as one of its greatest-ever players — but on Friday it dismissed him from its board of directors.

item.title: Japan wants to hire more bear hunters after record number of people attacked
item.description: In the past six months, there have been four times the number of people killed by bears compared with last year, and the Japanese government wants to hire hunters to help cull the animals.

item.title: Flare used at Melbourne Oasis concert
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Monkey escape in Mississippi gives a glimpse into the secretive world of animal research
item.description: A truck carrying 21 research monkeys overturned in Mississippi, spilling wooden crates labelled "live monkeys" into the tall grass near the highway.

item.title: Australia criticises 'lost opportunity' for strengthened Antarctic conservation
item.description: The Australian government says it's "disappointed" after an international conservation meeting in Hobart failed to reach agreement on improved protection measures in Antarctica.

item.title: Giant hail causes injuries and damage to cars, homes across south-east Queensland
item.description: Giant hailstones, lightning and rain have lashed parts of the state's south-east with supercell storm activity reported.

item.title: NSW mental health nurse disqualified after intimate relationship with patient
item.description: The NSW Civil and Administrative Tribunal has found a mental health nurse guilty of professional misconduct after she was observed hugging and kissing a patient.

item.title: Eagles to make historic AFLW finals appearance after Swans fall to Bombers
item.description: Daisy Pearce's West Coast Eagles have reached the AFLW finals for the first time after the Sydney Swans blew their chance in a shock three-point loss to struggling Essendon at Coffs Harbour.

item.title: Man charged after woman's body found in home near Cessnock
item.description: Police have charged a man in connection with the violent death of a 39-year-old woman in a home near Cessnock.

item.title: APEC world leaders meeting highlights idea of 'free and fair' global trade is severely wounded
item.description: While Donald Trump skipped the APEC conference, Xi Jinping was positioning China as a believer in free and fair trade, and multilateralism.

item.title: Police charge teen after officers allegedly assaulted at Byford Halloween party
item.description: Two police officers were allegedly assaulted while shutting down an out-of-control Halloween party attended by hundreds of people in Perth's southern suburbs.

item.title: Hail fell at Pilton in the Toowoomba region
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Hail fell at Esk, north of Brisbane
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Melbourne Cup 2025 field, horses, form guide and betting
item.description: Supporters of the favourite Half Yours are smiling after Saturday's barrier draw, but the forecast for heavy rain in the coming days could reshape the chances of the 24 contenders. Explore our interactive form guide to all the horses set to line up in Tuesday's great race.

item.title: US House Democrats call on Prince Andrew to answer questions about Epstein links
item.description: Democratic members of a US congressional committee investigating the Jeffrey Epstein case are calling on Andrew Mountbatten Windsor, the former prince, to answer questions about the convicted sex offender.

item.title: Tanzanian president Samia Suluhu Hassan wins disputed election with more than 97pc of vote, results show
item.description: The result is likely to amplify the concerns of critics, opposition groups and others who said the election was not a contest but a coronation, after the president's two main rivals were barred or prevented from running.

item.title: Three players sin-binned as Australia win torrid second Test 14-4 over England to retain Ashes
item.description: Australia have won a tough physical battle in Liverpool to claim the second Test against England and ensure they will retain the Ashes.

item.title: England power past Wallabies 25-7 at Twickenham as Matt Dawson slams Australians as being 'woeful'
item.description: The Wallabies were overpowered by a disciplined and ruthless England team, who won their eighth-straight international to claim victory at Twickenham.

item.title: One of seven Louvre heist suspects released without charge
item.description: Lawyers have said one of the seven suspects in the infamous jewellery theft at the Louvre Museum has been released without being charged.

item.title: Trump and Xi prove they aren't just great rivals but politicians fighting for survival back home
item.description: Donald Trump's gains are immediate and personal while Xi Jinping's are quiet, reversible, and strategic

item.title: Share your experience with the housing market
item.description: What's your experience looking to buy your first home, or find an affordable, stable rental? We want to hear from you.

item.title: As US government shutdown drags on, 42 million people could be affected by food program cuts
item.description: Isaac Stein should be at his day job as a lawyer for the Internal Revenue Service, but instead, he's making hot dogs as the US government shutdown drags on.

item.title: Prince Andrew is leaving Windsor Estate. Why wasn't he given another property on the grounds?
item.description: Andrew Mountbatten Windsor's eviction from his mansion in Windsor Castle is the latest part of a reshuffle of royals around the estate's grounds. Here's where everyone lives.

item.title: Australians are being priced out of the property market and first home buyers schemes might not be helping
item.description: A recent auction for a three-bedroom townhouse in Brisbane has captured just how much property prices have skyrocketed in recent years, highlighting the nation’s fast-growing housing affordability crisis.

item.title: When is the RBA meeting next? When will interest rates go down?
item.description: Many people paying off mortgages were hoping for a cash rate cut, but recent inflation data means that is highly unlikely.

item.title: Labor takes fight to Greens in key seats over environment laws
item.description: As it negotiates with the Greens and the Coalition over its proposed overhaul of environment laws, Labor is preparing a campaign accusing the minor party of obstructing its agenda.

item.title: New York's underbelly is thriving — this FBI case pulled back the curtain
item.description: The New York mafia is alive and an "historic" FBI bust has shown that underworld crime is still kicking across the United States.

item.title: Strong filial responsibilities can make discussing aged care a sensitive topic among multicultural families.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Talking about aged care in multicultural families can be hard but these tips may help
item.description: Discussing aged care in culturally diverse families can be a sensitive subject. Here's how some approached the conversation.

item.title: Anthony Van Dyck broke down during the 2020 Melbourne Cup
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Horse racing replays edited to remove falls and deaths as industry grapples with social licence
item.description: For years, the racing industry has been quietly removing falls and deaths from its replays. Now, industry insiders are speaking out.

item.title: I tried to outsmart the social media algorithm. Here's how it outsmarted me
item.description: Armed with a burner phone and a fake name, I set out to learn how Instagram’s algorithm really works. This is what happened next.

item.title: How local journalists carry their communities through grief when reporting from within
item.description: When tragedy strikes in small communities, the news doesn't fade when the cameras leave. It lingers in the streets, in the schools, in the quiet corners of local shops.

item.title: Tasmanian couple buys the Eulo Queen Hotel in outback Queensland
item.description: Adam and Prue Brancher had no experience running a pub when they decided to uproot their lives in Tasmania and move to outback Queensland.

item.title: A game for the ages: Nan and teen granddaughter line up together in country netball
item.description: A grandmother and granddaughter played for their regional Victorian netball team, turning a secret plan into a moment of country sport history.

item.title: Copper theft costing Queensland taxpayers millions of dollars every year, as rate of crime increases
item.description: Experts say cost of living pressures, and the ability to make money quickly, is behind a surge in copper thefts which are leaving highways and sporting fields in the dark.

item.title: Do the Queensland government’s claims about the surgical waiting list stack up?
item.description: Queensland's government declared victory on elective surgery wait times but thousands of patients are waiting longer than recommended — and specialists warn the fix is short-term at best.

item.title: From death masks to selfies: The history of our love-affair with portraits
item.description: Whether it's an ancient death mask found on an Egyptian sarcophagus or the selfie you have just cropped on your phone, we have been creating portraits for centuries. So why do we love them so much?

item.title: How taxidermists are 'honouring the life' of extraordinary creatures through art and science
item.description: From a taxidermied mynah bird perched on a teacup to a mammoth leatherback turtle, here are the "extraordinary creatures" these taxidermists are preserving.

item.title: House prices have been climbing for a generation. Undoing the damage could take even longer
item.description: It's an inconvenient truth that a housing crisis that took a generation to create cannot be fixed easily. The damage will likely take another generation to undo, unless the solution comes at the expense of those who already own their homes.

item.title: Australian number one Maya Joint loses in Hong Kong Open semis, Kim Birrell through to Chennai final
item.description: Australian number one Maya Joint falls short of reaching the Hong Kong Open final, but compatriot Kimberly Birrell wins through to the tournament decider in Chennai.

item.title: Israel says three bodies returned from Gaza are not those of hostages held by Hamas
item.description: Hamas says it offered to hand over samples of the unidentified bodies, but Israel refused and asked for the remains for examination.

item.title: Think you've got what it takes to top this quiz? It's time to play ... HARD!
item.description: Let's get it straight: you'll probably do badly on this quiz, and I'll judge you. It's time to play … HARD!

item.title: Pitch invader stands with Kangaroos during national anthems before Ashes Test against England
item.description: A man is arrested by police after he lined up next to Cameron Munster before the Kangaroos' victory over England in the second Ashes Test in England.

item.title: Rock climbers' defiance grows over Mount Arapiles cultural site requests
item.description: Rock climbers are publicly urging others to ignore Parks Victoria's requests to avoid culturally significant routes at Mount Arapiles Dyurrite in western Victoria.

item.title: Watch Australian Story's 'It's my pARTy', 8pm Monday on ABCTV and ABC iview.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Kirsha Kaechele banned men from MONA's Ladies Lounge — and won
item.description: No men are allowed at Kirsha Kaechele's Ladies Lounge and the Supreme Court agrees. The artist, curator and "missus" of MONA's owner knows how to cross boundaries, but can she solve Tasmania's thorniest dispute?

item.title: Clean-up begins in south-east Queensland after homes, cars damaged by giant hailstones
item.description: More than 2,500 people across the region remain without power after fast-moving storms and giant hail caused damage on Saturday.

item.title: Fishers and researchers are working together to create a 'transformational' data set
item.description: An international program in which researchers collaborate with the fishing industry is generating a dataset that will change global weather forecasting.

item.title: Sting linked to AN0M encrypted app which brought down criminals around the world enters new phase
item.description: An international covert sting linked to the encrypted AN0M platform which brought down hundreds of alleged criminals and netted cash, drugs and weapons has reached a new phase.

item.title: Plan to apply commercial council rates for short-stay rentals sparks debate
item.description: A council in South Australia wants to charge short-stay rentals such as AirBnBs at a higher rate, saying they act as businesses.

item.title: Donald Trump warns Nigerian government of US military action over alleged killings of Christians
item.description: Donald Trump is threatening to pull US aid and going "guns-a-blazing" as he accuses the Nigerian government of allowing the killing of Christians.

item.title: UK police arrest two people after stabbings on train in Cambridgeshire
item.description: Train operator London North Eastern Railway closes all its railway lines while emergency services deal with the incident at Huntingdon station.

item.title: Women's crisis shelter waits years to sub-lease vacant NT building
item.description: An Aboriginal-led domestic violence support service is demanding answers over stalled progress in establishing a women's shelter in remote Northern Territory.

item.title: Qld police say workers compensation scheme adds to psychological distress
item.description: Labelled "combative" and "demeaning" by some Queensland police and academics, the WorkCover claims process leaves a former officer questioning her self-worth.

item.title: Jockey Ethan Brown makes rise from from near-fatal fall to Melbourne Cup
item.description: Two years after a near-fatal fall, 25-year-old Alice Springs-born jockey has had a bumper season with 32 wins. Now he is riding in the Melbourne Cup.

item.title: Calls for road map for disability emploment providers after Bedford's troubles
item.description: Some in the disability employment sector say they are operating in an increasingly complex and changing environment, and that there is a need for a clear way forward for organisations supporting people with complex needs.
